name: 學習素材設計與製作
description: This course examines the basic elements of instructional production as it relates to multimedia, including web-based platform. The design concepts are explored by surveying a variety of instructional design models while the production concepts are explored and practiced by engaging students in collaborative projects along with thinking about the underlying design/production theories. Students in this course will learn to design and develop instructional materials using the following media as tools: audio, video, web authoring, virtual reality, web 2.0 platforms and social software/websites.
goals: •	Review current research that deals with specific design issues related to instructional design and media production
•	Based on good practice, design and develop instructional materials using multiple media and tools
• Practice critiquing instructional materials and media
syllabus:
The course will progress with the following themes: 

1.Foundation of instructional design and development

2.Theory and practice of ADDIE model, and other popular instructional design models

3.Design and development of multimedia-based instructional materials

4.Critique and evaluation of the effectiveness of instructional materials

5.Emerging library technologies, trends and innovations  
The course is divided into nine modules. Supplement readings and case studies will be added into each module.
